# Remote Work Statistics & Trends 2026: The Complete Data

*Last Updated: January 04, 2026*

**Editorial Note:** This article provides analysis and insights based on the latest industry data and expert opinions.

---

## Key Takeaways

Remote work continues to evolve in 2026. We've compiled the latest statistics from Gallup, McKinsey, and Bureau of Labor Statistics to show where the workforce is heading.

---

## Current Remote Work Numbers

As of 2026, approximately 28% of US workers are fully remote, 35% are hybrid, and 37% are fully on-site. This represents stabilization from the post-pandemic fluctuation.

---

## Industry-Specific Trends

Tech leads with 67% remote/hybrid, followed by finance (52%) and professional services (48%). Manufacturing and healthcare remain predominantly on-site.

---

## Productivity and Satisfaction Data

Studies show remote workers report 23% higher job satisfaction and equivalent or higher productivity. However, new employees may benefit from more in-person time during onboarding.

---
